result.execSummary:
The defendant Brent M. Thiede was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
SENTENCED TO 4 YEARS IN THE WISCONSIN STATE PRISON SYSTEM. 2 YEARS INITIAL CONFINEMENT FOLLOWED BY 2 YEARS EXTENDED SUPERVISION.

Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE TO ANY SENTENCE HE IS CURRENTLY SERVING

superMiscConds.notes: MAINTAIN FULL TIME EMPLOYMENT OR SCHOOLING
PROVIDE DNA SAMPLE IF NOT PREVIOUSLY PROVIDED

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Transcript - Sentencing Hearing on 1/7/15
Reporter:  Jill Bartol

Judgement of Conviction and Order - ERP 
with completion certificate
s/BNB/6-29-17

Defendant Brent M. Thiede in court with attorney Jon R. Wilsnack.  Defendant Brent M. Thiede in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both parties have received the PSI and the Revocation Order and Warrant and are prepared to proceed today.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing arguments.  Joint recommendation of 4 years prison with 2 years incarceration followed by 2 years extended supervision.  Requests conditions of extended supervision.  Atty Wilsnack agrees with the recommendations and makes statement.  Defendant makes statement to the Court.  
BY THE COURT:  
07CF121:
Court sentences defendant to serve 4 years in the Wisconsin Prison System, consecutive to any sentence he is currently serving:  2 years initial confinement followed by 2 years extended supervision.  Conditions:  *Granted 149 days credit for time already served.  *Pay outstanding court costs of $197.03 and restitution in the amount of $644.07.  *Maintain full-time eployment or schooling.  *Maintain absolute sobriety.  *AODA aftercare and treatment.

14CF68:
Court sentences defendant to serve 4 years in the Wisconsin Prison System, consecutive to any sentence he is currently serving:  2 years initial confinement followed by 2 years extended supervision.  Conditions:  *Pay court costs of $268.00.  *Pay DNA surcharge of $250.00.  *Submit DNA sample if not previously provided.  *Pay restitution in the total amount of $7016.08.  *Maintain full-time eployment or schooling.  *Maintain absolute sobriety.  *AODA aftercare and treatment.

**Defendant is eligible for ERP and CIP.

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Sentencing hearing on January 7, 2015 at 10:45 am.

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.
PSI ordered
Set for Sentencing on both cases.

Defendant Brent M. Thiede in court with attorney Jon R. Wilsnack.  Defendant Brent M. Thiede in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
07CF121 & 14CF68:
Atty Hendee states what both cases are set for and in talking with Atty Wilsnack; both parties are in agreement with proceeding today.  Atty Hendee states that parties will be requesting a PSI.
14CF68:
Atty Wilsnack agrees and waives his Prelim.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees.
Court questions Atty Wilsnack on the waiver of the Prelim.  Atty Wilsnack responds.    Defendant agrees with the waiver of the Prelim.  Court accepts defendant's waiver of Prelim.
  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information..
  Defendant received a copy of the information & waives it's reading.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 10:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 6, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 6, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Brent M. Thiede in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant will be represented by Atty Wilsnack per Atty Gumz.  Atty Hendee states that the defendant also has 07CF121 which is set for Nov. 6th at 9:30am.  Atty Hendee states that it might be appropriate to reset so Atty Wilsnack is able to be here.

 BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 6, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2014 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Brent M. Thiede in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant is also on a probation hold.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.   Defendant wants to get ahold of the PD office.  
Court advises defendant his right to a Preliminary Hearing.  Defendant would like to waive the time limits for the Prelim.
BY THE COURT:  Court accepts defendant's waiver of the time limits.
Reset to give defendant time to get an Attorney.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 10:45 am.
Initial appearance on September 8, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Brent M. Thiede in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Atty Hendee states that normally he would be asking for a substantial amount of cash bond.  However, the defendant is on a PO hold  for case 07CF121, therefore, the State does not object to a signature bond.  There is a detainer from Columbia County as well.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond.
*no conditions set  Initial appearance scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
